ygData.messageBody:
My opinion is that it is very inappropriate for Bards to get "bind", even if
it were self-only. We already are the fastest overland movers in the game.
If we had bind we would be unbalanced in that when we die, corpse retrieval
for us would be simpler than for any other class.

Make friends with a caster.

Crier Sharpsong - 23rd Bard on Fennin Ro


Jason A. Farqu´┐¢
CDI at http://www.pigging.com/



----- Original Message -----
From: <Mike.Langlois@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, September 22, 1999 12:53 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Petiton to replace level 14 song


> From: Mike.Langlois@...
>
>
>
> I'm interested in the binding song...and I agree that it is unlikely to be
> approved. However, here's my 2 cp:
>
> 14 level is an appropriate level to be able to bind. This matches the
classes
> that can bind, as clerics are the last to get it at 14th.
>
> The magic model for the Bard class is for us to have prettty much one or two
of
> each type of spell. We have a little speed, DoT, teleport, DD, Heal, etc.
The
> only powers we dont have are lifetap or bind. I don't think lifetap fits
with
> the Bardic image, so bind looks good.
>
> The other hybrids don't get bind...but we aren't really a hybrid class.
Each
> other hybrid is a warrior/specific magic class. As a result, they get magic
> plus superior battle skills. Since our battle skills are less than all
other
> hybrids...really on par with clerics if truth be told, then perhaps we can
get a
> pure caster attribute like bind to make up for it.
>
> Anyway, bind would be my vote...
>
> Golias of Solusek Ro
